result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davian D Bernard-Kleckley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Davian D Bernard-Kleckley appeared by video.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Davian D Bernard-Kleckley.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a deferred prosecution agreement hearing. Defense requests an adjournment to discuss case with client. Discussion held on the record. Defendant lives out of state, and Defense requests to have Defendant appear by Zoom at the next hearing. Court grants adjournment.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Davian D Bernard-Kleckley in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Davian D Bernard-Kleckley appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
Case in court for status conference.  
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Case is in DPA posture, defendant has a TAD evaluation scheduled for 9/13/2022.
Defense requests a Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing and for defendant to appear by Zoom due to living out of state. 
Court instructed defense counsel to efile form CR-295 and Court will grant defendant to appear by Zoom. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Davian D Bernard-Kleckley in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.  Defense in receipt of discovery and no offer. State placed Offer for a dpa pending tad evaluation results.
Defense moves for dismissal of this case. Arguments heard. Court Denied defendant motion. 
Parties advised: Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  
Court ordered case adjourned. Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with B.A.R.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Davian D Bernard-Kleckley in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Davian D Bernard-Kleckley in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
